newsitem.title: USA: Country music's Carl Perkins in Tennessee hospital.
newsitem.headline: Country music's Carl Perkins in Tennessee hospital.

text.p: Carl Perkins, the rockabilly legend who wrote "Blue Suede Shoes," was reported in stable and satisfactory condition on Tuesday at a Memphis hospital where he is undergoing tests.
A spokeswoman for Baptist Memorial Hospital said the 65-year-old entertainer was admitted on Sunday for tests but declined to release any information beyond his condition.
Local broadcasters said Perkins was being examined for a blocked carotid artery. Such arteries in the neck and head supply blood to the brain and a blockage can lead to a stroke.

Perkins, who survived throat cancer four years ago, sold more than 2 million copies of "Blue Suede Shoes" when he wrote and recorded it on the Memphis-based Sun label four decades ago. Elvis Presley recorded it later and sold millions more.
He was awarded the National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences "Lifetime Achievement Award" for the song and with Chuck Berry is considered a founder of modern rock guitar.
Perkins also wrote the Johnny Cash classic "Daddy Sang Bass."
